title: 15-Minute Beef Ramen Skillet
description: One-pan beef and ramen with bagged slaw for a true 15-minute, family-approved protein meal.
instructions: Brown beef in oil over medium-high heat; drain if needed.
Add water, ramen bricks, coleslaw, soy, and garlic powder; cover 3–4 minutes.
Toss until noodles are tender and lightly glossy; serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High protein supports athlete needs on busy nights
One pan minimizes cleanup to prevent parent burnout

title: Sheet Pan Baked Chicken Tacos
description: Four-ingredient sheet pan tacos using rotisserie chicken for realistic, quick dinners.

ingredients.notes: Warm on sheet pan; use large sheet pan (18×13 inches) if available

instructions: Spread beans on tortillas; top with chicken and cheese.
Bake on a large sheet pan (18×13 inches) at 400°F for 10–12 minutes until cheese is melted and tortillas are crisp at edges.
Serve with bagged salad to complete the meal.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward tacos that reheat well for leftovers
Sheet pan method reduces dishes and time
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: One-Pan Chicken Enchilada Skillet
description: Dump-and-simmer skillet with rotisserie chicken and pantry staples for minimal cleanup and fast results.

ingredients.notes: Use entire 15-oz can drained or 2 cups frozen

instructions: Simmer sauce, beans, corn, tortilla strips 5–7 minutes.
Stir in chicken to warm; top with cheese and melt.
Serve with bagged salad or pre-cut veggies.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Balanced meal meets athlete protein needs
One-pan approach minimizes cleanup time
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Quick Beef & Potato Skillet
description: Meat-and-potatoes classic optimized for speed using small dice and one pan.
instructions: Brown beef; add microwaved potatoes and onion; sauté until browned.
Season with paprika, salt, pepper; serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein + complex carbs fuel training and growth
Minimal dishes prevents burnout
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Egg Roll in a Bowl (15 Minutes)
description: Cabbage slaw and ground turkey with soy-ginger seasoning for a fast, one-pan dinner.
instructions: Brown turkey; add coleslaw, soy, garlic, and ginger; toss 3–4 minutes.
Serve over microwave rice if desired.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein target met with minimal prep
Family-friendly flavors increase compliance
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: BBQ Chicken Power Bowls
description: 10-minute assembly bowls using rotisserie chicken and microwave grains for a no-cook dinner.
instructions: Microwave rice; toss chicken with BBQ sauce.
Assemble bowls with rice and chicken; serve with salad.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward dinner with zero cooking
Scales easily for multiple athletes
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Turkey Zucchini Skillet
description: Lasagna-style flavors in a lighter, faster skillet format using pre-diced vegetables.
instructions: Brown turkey; add zucchini, marinara, seasoning; simmer 5–7 minutes.
Top with mozzarella to melt and serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-rich comfort meal done fast
One-pan and shortcuts reduce total time
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Chicken Tenders & Broccoli Sheet Pan
description: Kid-friendly sheet pan tenders and broccoli with honest timing and minimal cleanup.
instructions: Toss tenders and broccoli with oil, salt, pepper on a large sheet pan (18×13 inches).
Bake at 425°F for 15–18 minutes, flipping once, until chicken reaches 165°F internal temperature and broccoli is tender-crisp.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Solid protein + vegetable pairing with minimal effort
Scales to two pans for team dinners
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Marry Me Chicken Pasta (Weeknight)
description: 30-minute version of the internet classic adapted for busy wrestling families.

ingredients.notes: Cooked; using full box prevents waste

instructions: Sear chicken; remove. Sauté (cook quickly in a small amount of oil over medium heat) garlic, add half-and-half and sun-dried tomatoes; simmer 3–4 minutes until slightly thickened.
Return chicken; toss with pasta and Parmesan; season.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein comfort meal improves adherence
Time-honest approach fits weeknights
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Creamy Chicken Orzo Bake
description: Dump-and-bake orzo with chicken and vegetables for a hands-off family dinner.
instructions: Combine all in a baking dish; cover and bake at 400°F for 30–35 minutes, stirring once.
Rest 5 minutes, stir until creamy and pasta is tender, and serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein, reheats well for leftovers
Hands-off method saves active time
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Ground Beef Casserole (No Canned Soup)
description: Simple, hearty casserole delivering protein with basic pantry ingredients and minimal cleanup.

ingredients.notes: Use entire jar to prevent waste
Using full box prevents waste; parboiling speeds bake

instructions: Brown beef; mix with sauce and parboiled pasta; transfer to dish; top with mozzarella and bake 20 minutes at 375°F.
Rest 5 minutes and serve.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein and carbs support busy training nights
Leftovers simplify next-day meals
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Chicken Salad Power Wraps
description: Rotisserie-based wraps with Greek yogurt dressing for a protein boost and 10-minute assembly.
instructions: Mix yogurt and mustard; fold in chicken and celery.
Fill tortillas and roll into wraps.
wrestling_specific_benefits: High-protein, quick assembly for post-practice dinners
Easy to scale for multiple athletes
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: One-Pan Sausage & Vegetables
description: Dump-and-roast sausage with mixed vegetables for a simple, satisfying tray dinner.
instructions: Toss all on a large sheet pan (18×13 inches); roast at 425°F for 20 minutes, stirring once.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Minimal cleanup keeps quick-meal promise
Balanced protein and vegetables for athletes
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Quick Turkey Taco Skillet
description: 20-minute family taco skillet using pantry spices and pre-diced onions.
instructions: Brown turkey with onion; add tomato sauce and seasoning; simmer 5 minutes.
Serve with chips or tortillas and bagged salad.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-focused taco night done in 20 minutes
Family appeal increases consistency
storage: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.

title: Buffalo Chicken Mac (Fast)
description: Comfort food with a protein boost using rotisserie chicken and boxed mac for an honest 25–30 minute meal.
instructions: Prepare mac and cheese; fold in chicken, hot sauce, and yogurt; heat through.
Serve with steamed frozen broccoli for balance.
wrestling_specific_benefits: Protein-forward comfort food increases adherence
Adds vegetables with minimal extra time
storage_instructions: Best within 3–4 days refrigerated. Reheat to 165°F.
